description: a(n) is the coefficient of the term a^(-n) in the asymptotic series for the least positive zero of the generalized Rogers-Ramanujan continued fraction.
references: Berndt, B. C.; Huang, S.-S.; Sohn, J.; and Son, S. H. "Some Theorems on the Rogers-Ramanujan Continued Fraction in Ramanujan's Lost Notebook."
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Rogers-Ramanujan Continued Fraction
prog: (PARI) {RR(n,w,z,p,po,i,m,h,h1,j,w1,h2)=w=1+O(x^(n+1)); p=1; po =1; for(i=1,n,w=p-po*x*q^i; po=p; p=w); m=poldegree(w); w1=0; for(i=0,m,h=polcoeff(w,i); h1=0; for (j=1,n-1+i,h1=h1+polcoeff(h,j)*q^j); w1=w1+h1*x^i); q=0; for (i=1,n-1,q=q+s[i]/x^i); q=q+y/x^n; z=eval(w1); kill(q); h2=polcoeff(z,-(n-1)); polcoeff(h2,1)*polcoeff(h2,0)*(-1)} s=vector(30); s[1]=1; print(s[1]); for (j=2,30,s[j]=RR(j); print(s[j]));
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: PARI program and more terms from Kok Seng Chua (chuaks(AT)ihpc.nus.edu.sg), Jun 13 2000
